course_title: Topics in Business Administration - TOPICS BUS ADMIN

001.comments: This course will provide an introduction into theoretical and empirical work in behavioral corporate finance and behavioral asset pricing. We will consider agents (investors, managers, etc.) with different types of less-than-fully rational beliefs and non-standard preferences and consequences of such beliefs and preferences for asset prices and corporate decisions. We will discuss various impediments to arbitrage, learning, and competition in labor markets that prevent rational decision-makers from undoing the effects of behavioral biases of others.
